numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that young women tend to contact their parents more than young men do.
2. Young women and young men both prefer to send text messages.
3. For young women and young men, visiting in person might be a last option.
4. I wonder what factors the researchers considered when they chose the population for this study.
5. One possible factor is the distance between a person and the parents of the person.
6. One possible factor is the quality of the relationship between a person and the parents of the person.
7. One possible factor is the job situation of a person.
8. One possible factor is whether a person is a father or a mother.
9. This study relates to me and my community.
11. In my community, it is common that people contact their parents.
12. In my community, people contact their parents by calls or by text messages or in person.
13. My senior class will transition to college.
14. If my senior class transitions to college, in-person contact will become more limited.
15. If in-person contact becomes more limited, we will use text messages and phone calls to communicate.
16. The headline is: Has technology caused communicating to become completely digital?
